title: single_version_override() drops patch_cmds if no patches are given

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Someone outside the Bazel team could own this

body:
### Description of the bug:


It appears that `single_version_override()` completely ignores `patch_cmds` when no `patches` attribute is given.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

External Dependency

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


In a repo whose `MODULE.bazel` is
```
bazel_dep(
    name = "curl",
    version = "8.11.0",
)
single_version_override(
    module_name = "curl",
    patch_cmds = [
        "touch /tmp/I-WAS-HERE",
        "cat BUILD.bazel",
        "false",

        # Arrange to load the needed cc rules.
        r"""sed -i '1 i\load("@rules_cc//cc:defs.bzl", "cc_binary", "cc_library")' BUILD.bazel""",
    ],
    version = "8.11.0",
)
```
the `patch_cmds` are completely ignored.  Doing `bazelisk mod show_repo curl` shows no `patch_cmds` attribute on the rule:
```
$ bazelisk mod show_repo curl
ERROR: @@bazel_tools//tools/cpp:cc_configure.bzl does not export a module extension called cc_configure_extension, yet its use is requested at https://bcr.bazel.build/modules/re2/2024-07-02/MODULE.bazel:22:29

http_archive(
  name = "curl+",
  urls = ["https://github.com/curl/curl/releases/download/curl-8_11_0/curl-8.11.0.tar.gz"],
  integrity = "sha256-JkU32Q5Y0rCd3cUJRLrzw45wiRUciYZxXiquqvK4EY8=",

```

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


Ubuntu 24.04

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.4.1

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_
